titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Pamela Askew Papers, approximately 1950-1980
titlestmt.author: Inventory prepared by Mark Seidl

publicationstmt.publisher: Archives and Special Collections Library, Vassar College Libraries

profiledesc.creation: Finding aid encoded by Mark Seidl October 2008

did.head: Collection Summary

repository.label: Repository:
repository.corpname: Archives and Special Collections Library, Vassar College Libraries

did.abstract: Lecture notes, manuscripts, typescripts, correspondence, research materials documenting the academic career of Pamela Askew.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: A specialist in Italian Renaissance painting, Pamela Askew began teaching art history at Vassar in 1946 as a part-time instructor. She joined the faculty permanently in 1955 and continued to teach in the Art Department until her retirement in 1985. In addition to teaching, Askew served as curator of the Vassar College Art Gallery from 1956 to 1960. Born on February 2, 1925, she died on June 26, 1997.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: The Pamela Askew Papers contains lecture notes for art history courses taught at Vassar College, mainly Art 105 and Art 350. It also contains manuscripts, typescripts, correspondence, and research materials pertaining to Askew's scholarship on Domenico Fetti.

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: This collection is open for research according to the regulations of the Vassar College Archives and Special Collections Library without any additional restrictions.

userestrict.head: Restrictions on Use
userestrict.p: Some materials in Series VI and IX are very fraglie, so use of these may be restricted. Please consult archivist for further information. The remainder of the collection is open for use. Permission to quote (publish) from unpublished or previously published material must be obtained as described in the regulations of the Vassar College Archives and Special Collections Library.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Collection processed by Laura Streett, August 2008, and Mark Seidl, March 2012.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Collection acquired in two parts: the first in May 2008 as a transfer from the Vassar College Visual Resources Library (M2008-011); and the second in March 2012 as a transfer from the Vassar College Art Department (M2012-001).

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Pamela Askew Papers, Archives and Special Collections Library, Vassar College Libraries.
